sentence.Network_en: Coincidentally, I had once found myself in a similar situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 巧得很，我曾经碰到过类似的情况。

sentence.Network_en: They immediately got in touch with Dr Ting who was, purely coincidentally, also in California.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们立即与丁博士联系，真是巧得很，他也在加利福尼亚。

sentence.Network_en: Two Manchester City fans, Geoff Watts and Howard Davies, coincidentally wrote similar letters to the club.
sentence.Network_cn: 说来也巧，两个曼城队球迷杰夫·沃茨和霍华德·戴维斯给俱乐部写了类似的信。

entry.def: You use coincidentally when you want to draw attention to a coincidence.

example.ex: Coincidentally, I had once found myself in a similar situation...
example.tran: 巧得很，我曾经碰到过类似的情况。

example.ex: They immediately got in touch with Dr Ting who was, purely coincidentally, also in California...
example.tran: 他们立即与丁博士联系，真是巧得很，他也在加利福尼亚。

auth_sentence.content: It was, coincidentally, a moment of national trauma.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was, coincidentally, a moment of national trauma.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was, coincidentally, a moment of national trauma.

auth_sentence.content: Not coincidentally, this was shortly after flowers first appeared.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not coincidentally, this was shortly after flowers first appeared.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not coincidentally, this was shortly after flowers first appeared.

auth_sentence.content: Coincidentally, it costs far more in the US than gasoline.
auth_sentence.res_content: Coincidentally, it costs far more in the US than gasoline.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Coincidentally, it costs far more in the US than gasoline.
